newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Seismic event to affect Vaal Reefs output.
newsitem.headline: Seismic event to affect Vaal Reefs output.

text.p: Anglo American Corp of South Africa Ltd said on Thursday gold production at its Vaal Reefs Exploration and Mining Co Ltd in the March and June quarters will be down by one percent due to a seismic event which occurred on February 10.
The seismic event, which measured 4.5 on the Richter Scale, took place in the mine's North Lease area, Anglo's gold and uranium division, AngloGold, said in a statement.
It said no employees were in the affected area at the time and added that the section concerned will be rehabilitated by the end of June.
"The resultant loss of gold production in both the March and June quarters is estimated at two percent for the North Lease area and one percent for Vaal Reefs as a whole," AngloGold said.
Vaal Reefs produced 16,991 kg of gold in the three months to end-December, compared to 16,968 kg in the preceding quarter.
